description: Numbers that are the product of their digits raised to positive integer powers.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..120
prog: (Haskell)a059405 n = a059405_list !! (n-1)a059405_list = filter f a238985_list where   f x = all (== 0) (map (mod x) digs) && g x digs where         g z []         = z == 1         g z ds'@(d:ds) = r == 0 && (h z' ds' || g z' ds)                          where (z', r) = divMod z d         h z []         = z == 1         h z ds'@(d:ds) = r == 0 && h z' ds' || g z ds                          where (z', r) = divMod z d         digs = map (read . return) $ filter (/= '1') $ show x-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 29 2015
author: _Erich Friedman_, Jan 29 2001
